alert.note: Alert for Grande Ronde Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 02 at 9:56AM PST until January 02 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR LADD AND PYLES CANYONS... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory for Ladd and Pyles Canyons, south winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts 50 to 55 mph. For the High Wind Warning, south winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Grande Ronde Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 1 PM PST this afternoon. For the High Wind Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...These strong winds may cause significant blowing snow from dry powdery snow that is currently on the ground. This may result in significant reductions in visibility. Travelers are urged to use caution.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
